UnitType.Quote: All great leaders need a right-hand man!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Friend, I am glad to see you. Glad to meet you. Do you have food? Do you have money? Would you hire me on to join you? %d gildar buys you my spear arm, and my undying loyalty.
UnitType.Backstory:
I'll tell you what, that Karavox... he has plans, that one, that's for sure. He's built himself a pretty little palace in Tanacabra. With a throne room bigger than the Queen's. Soon as I saw that, I knew; he didn't give a warg's ass about that prophecy. About uniting the kingdoms of man, helping the queen... what he does have in mind, I can't tell for sure. It's nothing good, though, I promise you that.
Can I have the rest of that ale now?

My name? You are correct, sir, it is a lord's name. A king's name, for I am descended of that line. I would be ruler of Redstone, rather than captain of the Free Riders, but... there was a disagreement about a King's proper role. I thought it necessary to be out from beyond the city walls. To lead from the vanguard, rather than the rear. Engrid - the city councillors - they thought otherwise. Our disagreement is now... concluded. These days I simply do what I can for the people of this cursed land.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: You will think me presumptuous, Lord, to ask this so soon... but there are three villages - innocents - in dire need of help. Let me join you, and then let us go to their rescue.

UnitType.Backstory: I am no stranger to hard times. I provided for my people for two score and ten years, as my uncle Norrez did before me. It was Norran who gathered our people after the Cataclysm, who made us whole. When the Krax brigands swept through the wildlands, slaying innocents, burning villages, Norrez led the Hashanii against them, and drove them south to Tanacabra. I am a thief, yes, but I have never stolen from those less well-off than me. I am not without honor, sir. And I am never without my dagger, which I will happily put to your service.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Noble sir. Well met. I am Birrez Hashaine - the king of thieves, a king without a people, though. A great disaster has befallen my tribe... perhaps you would like me to join yours? A modest fee - %d gildar - is all I require.

UnitType.Backstory: For grayskin to join with pink... this is strange, yes. But did not Salma Saladar join with Amarian, in the last days before the cataclysm? It has happened before. Let it happen now, Lord of the west. Let us join forces, and bring death to those who have wrought it here. These monsters, that vanish like wraiths after they attack. I do not say I will go against your orders, Lord. I will follow where you lead. But when we find these monsters - these wraiths - let Meergana lead. Let me kill when there is killing to be done.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I hate these monsters more than you do, Lord. They burned my village. Slew my family. Let us seek revenge together. %d gildar buys you my service.

UnitType.Backstory: Pinkskins, grayskins, whiteskins - Widkor does not care. Widkor is king!

What I am doing here? Why Lord, as I suggested when first we met... I am a jack-of-all-trades. I barter goods, and precious items for my living, meager as it is... and trade in Resoln has virtually ceased, after what has happened... you have heard tell of this Enchantress, have you not? She is...
I am sorry, Lord. By your expression, I see I have struck a nerve of some sort. I should have realized you would bear ill will towards she who deposed you.

I am from Vas Norga. You know this city? Great city. This is where the color of a man's skin does not matter. Where Quendar and Krax alike can walk in peace. This is where I am going now... where I was going, till you found me. Back to my home.

I am from Little Smolend - you have heard of Little Smolend? When Amarian raised his army, Little Smolend, we sent entire village to fight. To kill Titans for once and all. My great-great grandfather, Yagusk Pard, he was captain. He died - all his legion died - at hands of Titan Talax, at great siege of Imperium. This is story that came back to village - who knows if it is true or not, but to me... I believe. I wish to be hero, too - to shut mouths of people who say all Krax are traitors to race of man. I am no traitor.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Anyava is Krax, yes, but I do not follow Karavox. He is heerza - like weasel. I follow you, if you pay me. %d gildar.

UnitType.Backstory: This ain't New Pariden, Relias. There's no lords and ladies round here, so you'll forgive me if I don't bow and scrape the way you might be used to. I obey orders, and I do it without being told twice, that's what's important, ain't it? Yeah, my manners can use some work, I suppose, but my arrows fly true as you could ask for.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I'm as good a man as you can hire in these parts. %d gildar. Show me the gold, and I'll go where you command. Kill who you tell me to.

UnitType.Backstory: I need no companions; I want no well-wishers. I am old, but I am no cripple. I can hunt, and fetch water myself, and there is magic enough in these old bones to deal with any who would do me harm. Now leave me in peace, or I shall make you regret the day you darkened my doorway.

Bandits? No sir, we are not bandits. We are organized. We have a code of conduct. A set of rules, that governs our behavior. We do not kill women or children. We do not attack innocents. We seek to enforce order here, in these lands that have become lawless since the rise of the Fallen Enchantress - the fulfillment of the ancient prophecy. Cross us at your own peril.

Bandits? No sir, we are not bandits. We are organized. We have a code of conduct. A set of rules, that governs our behavior. We do not kill women or children. We do not attack innocents. We seek to enforce order here, in these lands that have become lawless since the rise of the Fallen Enchantress - the fulfillment of the ancient prophecy. Cross us at your own peril.

UnitType.Quote: I sense a power in you. A power I would take.
UnitType.Backstory: These beings were once men, channelers who desired knowledge of the darkest arts - the spells which layfolk call Death Magic. They sought out the master of such spells, the Black Sorcerer, and begged his favor. To win it, they performed acts of perversion and blasphemy near-unmentionable; Taher the Suffering was imbued after drowning his wife and children; Galiard of Colraine was gifted after spending three days in a burning coal pit. Yet none granted apprenticeship to the Black Sorcerer regret the price they paid. These Dark Wizards, as they are called, consider themselves greater than men now..
